metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9447 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the read_long_names function in libelf/elf_begin.c in elfutils 0.152 and 0.161 allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files to the root directory via a / (slash) in a crafted archive, as demonstrated using the ar program.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

elfutils - 0.158-0ubuntu5.2
libasm1 - 0.158-0ubuntu5.2
libdw1 - 0.158-0ubuntu5.2
libelf1 - 0.158-0ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Directory traversal is restricted to the root directory

criterions.comment: elfutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.158-0ubuntu5.2').
